text:
Problem 2.2

Extending Subtraction of Rational Numbers

In Problem 2.1 we used properties of numbers and operations to develop strategies for adding rational numbers.

  • We used 0 as the additive identity and the additive inverse properties (opposites). Ashley, wrote the following steps for the moves she made on a chip board playing the Game of Zero.

5 + –7 =

5 + (–5 + –2) =

(5 + –5) + –2 =

0 + –2 = –2

What would the chip board look like for each move?

• We learned that the order in which you add two numbers does not affect the sum. This is called the Commutative Property of Addition.

3 + -5 = -5 + 3 = -2

Is the Commutative Property true for subtraction?

This problem will help us answer questions like this one.
